Page n of nn

RSO (AR)

Next Steps

1.  Exam – close this course and take the exam (listed as a “task” in this course). You must get 100% on the exam, but you can have unlimited attempts. Once you are successful, contact your corps / squadron Commanding Officer (CO) so that they can select an Invigilator.

2.  Invigilator - your CO will select a certified Range Safety Officer to “invigilate” (plan and conduct) the rifle handling test and certification assessment.

3.  Rifle handling test – you must pass the air rifle handling test under the supervision of the Invigilator.

4.  Certification assessment – you must safely conduct an air rifle range activity, including:

•ensuring the set up of the range is safe;

•providing a briefing to participants,

•giving range commands, and

•demonstrating control and supervision of participants and staff.

 

Full details of the practical assessment steps can be found in the “Student Test Instructions” document in the reference section. Download this document for your reference.

 

Certification and recertification – once you have been successful in the rifle handling test and certification assessment, the Invigilator will the results to your Region and they will notify you once your certification has been approved. Only then can you conduct an air rifle range activity as a certified RSO.
Your RSO (AR) certification expires after 3 years – refer to CATO 24-14 for how to recertify.
